page.title: 06FIRE STATION (continued).
page.content: On average they have 35 to 45 standbys a year. Barcombe fire station is manned by ten fire men.Five of these are whole units,which means they are available all day and night.The other men are three quarter units because they work out of the village during part of the day. All the firemen are equipped with a strong jacket and leggings made of a fireproof material. They wear a helmet to protect their heads from falling masonry and rubber boots because of all the chemicals used in modern day fire fighting.For special fire fighting operations they have additional equipment, like breathing apparatus for entering smoke filled buildings.
